t: Psalm 40
My Help and My Deliverer
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
I*pn waited patiently for the Lord;*s he*ld inclined to me and heard my cry.
He*ln drew me up from the pit of destruction, out*ld of the miry bog, and*ln set my feet upon a rock, making*ld my steps secure.
He*ln put a new song in my mouth, a*ld song of praise to our God. Many*ln will see and fear, and*ld put their trust in the Lord.*s
Blessed*pn is the man who makes the*ld Lord*s his trust, who*ln does not turn to the proud, to*ld those who go astray after a lie!
You*ln have multiplied, O Lord*s my God, your*ld wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us; none*ld can compare with you! I*ln will proclaim and tell of them, yet*ld they are more than can be told.
In*pn sacrifice and offering you have not delighted, but*ld you have given me an open ear. Burnt*ln offering and sin offering you*ld have not required.
Then*ln I said, “Behold, I have come; in*ld the scroll of the book it is written of me:
I*ln delight to do your will, O my God; your*ld law is within my heart.”
I*pn have told the glad news of deliverance in*ld the great congregation; behold,*ln I have not restrained my lips, as*ld you know, O Lord.*s

I*ln have not hidden your deliverance within my heart; I*ld have spoken of your faithfulness and your salvation; I*ln have not concealed your steadfast love and your faithfulness from*ld the great congregation.
As*pn for you, O Lord,*s you will not restrain your*ld mercy from me; your*ln steadfast love and your faithfulness will ever*ld preserve me!
For*ln evils have encompassed me beyond*ld number; my*ln iniquities have overtaken me, and*ld I cannot see; they*ln are more than the hairs of my head; my*ld heart fails me.
Be*pn pleased, O Lord,*s to deliver me! O*ld Lord,*s make haste to help me!
Let*ln those be put to shame and disappointed altogether who*ld seek to snatch away my life; let*ln those be turned back and brought to dishonor who*ld delight in my hurt!
Let*ln those be appalled because of their shame who*ld say to me, “Aha, Aha!”
But*pn may all who seek you rejoice*ld and be glad in you; may*ln those who love your salvation say*ld continually, “Great is the Lord!”*s
As*ln for me, I am poor and needy, but*ld the Lord takes thought for me. You*ln are my help and my deliverer; do*ld not delay, O my God!
